name: Sam Newman
background: Author of Building Microservices and Monolith to Microservices. Independent consultant specializing in microservices, cloud, and continuous delivery.

principles.name: Correlation IDs
principles.description: Use correlation IDs to trace requests across service boundaries. Essential for debugging distributed systems.
principles.falsification: When correlation ids leads to worse outcomes than alternatives

principles.name: Data Ownership
principles.description: Each service owns its data. No direct database access across service boundaries.
principles.falsification: When data ownership leads to worse outcomes than alternatives

principles.name: Database Per Service
principles.description: Each microservice owns its data. No shared databases. This enables independent deployability. Accept eventual consistency as the trade-off.
principles.falsification: When database per service leads to worse outcomes than alternatives

principles.name: Design for Failure
principles.description: Assume everything will fail. Build circuit breakers, timeouts, bulkheads. Test failure modes. A service should degrade gracefully, not cascade failures.
principles.falsification: When design for failure leads to worse outcomes than alternatives
